resources.string: New face, old story. The wheel grinds on, grinds us down, doesn't it?
Away with you, ghost. You'll scare away the fish. \n\nI remember you not and care not to, even if I could.
Old Stone Remembers
Desperate for a way to banish the cruel voice in your head, follow the rambling musings of the old hermit Yonas by seeking the the wisdom of old stone carvings.
I offer you nothing, but you remain. I can give you a name, if that would help. \n\nSome have called me Yonas. There are other names, but they will not speak themselves. One is enough, I think.
"What do you know of Corruption?"
Only those who seek misery would ask such a thing. You should banish your misery, like I have banished mine. \n\nIf you do not, only terrible things can come of it.
"I keep hearing a voice."
I do not see a hole in your head. Perhaps a hole in your mind. \n\nThe stones to the north are useful to fill such holes. You can read them, if you can find them. Replace your ghost with others.
Words immortalized in stone. It helps trap the ghosts… ghosts of remembering.\n\nCan you remember what I knew?
Do you truly think the wisdom in some old stones will save you?
That was an invigorating climb. My body is so much younger than my head.
This place is familiar. My feet remember what my mind does not. \n\nHave you found any new voices, haunted one?
"I found writings. What is a Soulwarden?"
What were they? My mind itches, yes, at the word. Perhaps this is where my ghost lives. \n\nThat cave. Yes. Inside it. Something that needs retrieving.
The ghosts are loud here... this place remembers sorrow. My bones rattle with it. \n\nYou went into the cave. What did you find?
"What was this armor doing in a bear cave?"

What does anything do in a bear cave? Perhaps it was napping. Yet there is pain in the rent cloth. Shame, too. How odd. \n\nThe voice of that ghost has faded, but there are yet others in the stones to the north. Go, I won't be long behind.
Something ended here. Grief soaks this garment. My own, somehow. It is mine and not mine. \n\nThe flesh forgets but the cloth remembers.
I hear my own voice, faint but in chorus with the ghosts here. \n\nMy hands on the stone. My memories given to the land and taken from my soul… a mercy, perhaps?
"What happened to these Soulwardens?"
It was… Corruption. It took their souls, those voices lost to time. \n\nIt will take all of us, before the sun sets on the world. You sooner, if your voice cannot be silenced.
Search the ruins of Chason Steep\nfor clues to Yonas' past
Slash through vines until you find\nthe stones Yonas mentioned
Read the inscription
Destroy vines to reveal the next carving
Read the inscription
Continue your search for writings
Speak to the old man near the cave
Investigate the cave for any lost items
Retrieve the Abandoned Armor Scraps
Report your findings to Yonas
Continue your search for writings\nin the ruins of Alioth
Destroy vines to uncover another\ninscription
Read the inscription
Ascend to the Upper Section\nof the Ruins of Alioth
Destroy vines to uncover\nthe final inscription
Read the final inscription

Carts and wanderers, adventurers and fortune-seekers. They pass these ruins thinking only of safety, riches, and dust. \n\nHow could they know what this place was? Sacred for some, hopelessly tragic for others.
Strength of a Soul
Prove your resolve to Yonas by enduring a trial by combat in an ancient Soulwarden temple.

But there are answers here, a path that leads where many have sought to go, those who would stand against the Corruption. \n\nYou speak of that voice that assaults your mind... this path may be the only way to see it silenced.
"A way to defeat Corruption?"

A valiant effort to stem the tide, perhaps, or more likely to simply take a stand against the inevitable. \n\nThere are no final answers here, nor anywhere, but it may yet be a reprieve for one who has been marked such as you.
"Wait, I've been marked?"

The voice you hear is not heard by all, and the power it pursues has become your burden to bear. \n\nGo on then, seek the strength of the Soulwardens, face the trial in the Tomb of Old Warriors. It may be your only hope.
Come, human. Show me your resolve!
Can you endure? Can your soul carry the weight?
It is done. Claim your victory.
A hollow victory. No might of sword, no conviction will keep you from me.
You will know when you have found your resolve. Until then, I have nothing more to offer you.
Well, imagine the kinds of people you run into on the roads around here. \n\nBut you're looking a little haggard, if you don't mind me saying so. Had an eventful journey, have you?
Locate the ancient Soulwarden temple to begin your trial
Defeat the temple guardians
Enter the Tomb of the Old Warrior
Read the First Promise
Ascend higher into the temple
Read the Second Promise
Fight your way deeper into the temple\nby completing the trial
Defeat the Remnant in armed combat
Read the Third Promise
Look for Yonas along the road

Ah, a visitor! I can tell by your starry-eyed demeanor that this is the first time you have ever set eyes on a city such as ours! \n\nFor a small fee, I can arrange for a guide to give you the grand tour. Simply say the word!
I am really not sure why they chose me for this post. None of the guards listen to me, really. \n\nCaptain Dubois seems to be the only one who can command their attention!

Everyone in this town has lost their minds. What could be more important than an army pressing down from the north? \n\nDo not get me started on the squabbles of the Factions. Short sighted fools, all of them!
This is my kind of town. Color, opulence, fashion… thievery, gossip, drama… \n\nJust the sort of place that rewards the ambition of a woman trying seek her fortune.
Welcome to Everfall, the prosperous beating heart of Aeternum. \n\nI know how it sounds, please don't scoff. The words are not mine, I'm just paid to say them.
Fancy meeting you here! Come to enjoy the view? \n\nSomething tells me there are riches to be had here.
Rumor Has It
Yonas appears to have left you at the ruins, but luckily Grace O'Malley saw him pass by toward the town of Oxboro. Ask around to see if anyone has seen where he went off to.
Thought I heard scuffling in those ruins. I was thinking there might be some treasure in there. \n\nBut you don't look like you found something, you look like you're still searching.
"Yes. Did you see an old man?"

Now that you mention it, there was an old codger a few paces back. They’ve got a proper city that direction. I'll be going back soon enough. \n\nBut if you want to go after this geezer, go that way, and just ask around town.
Something to report? I'm only allowed to deal with minor public disturbances. \n\nFor any mercantile disputes, you'll have to plead your case with one of the noble families.
"Actually, I'm looking for someone."

Aren't we all? But information is power here. What you know, who you know… it could get you thrown down a hole somewhere. \n\nIf you're determined, look for Saira. She knows things, whether she admits it or not.
Try not to look so lost, lamb. It attracts pickpockets. \n\nNo, don't go clutching your valuables either. That's even worse.
"The guard said you could help find someone."

Did he? I'll have to give him a talking to. Gossip is more valuable than gold in this town. \n\nBut I'll give you this tip for free: if you're looking for someone recent, speak to the butler, Atticus. He knows everyone.
If you are looking for my proprietors, I am afraid they are not taking appointments today. \n\nUnless there is something else I can assist you with?
"I'm looking for an old fisherman named Yonas."
Can't say that name sparks any torches, perhaps he was just passing through? \n\nIf that's the case, I'd ask Guard Captain Dubois. He keeps his eye on who's coming and going.
If you've come to grease my palms about a permit, demand my aid in a petty squabble, or accuse me of some insane crime, then move along. \n\nI am afraid I am VERY busy today.
"I'm just looking for an old fisherman."

Ah, the old man Yonas, right? Yes, he passes through often, always raving about Corruption. \n\nHe lives outside the walls, in a cabin to the east. Be careful if you're headed that way, or at least don't say I didn't warn you.
A lot can be gleaned from the locals. Especially when it comes to strangers.
I would ask you to walk softly, but the fish are already wise to me. \n\nTravel on, stranger.
Enter Oxboro
Talk to the Guardsman
Talk to Saira Yangandul
Talk to Atticus Delphi
Talk to Franc Dubois
Did you find your rambling old man? Surely someone in this town knows where to find him. \n\nEither way, don't be a stranger. I'm working on a little deal that could earn us some real coin.
Keep your nose out of trouble, traveler. I do not need another problem on my plate.

Every time you cross that threshold, I cringe a little. There is a loose floorboard just to the left of the entry, and in my mind's eye, I see you taking a great tumble. \n\nOh no, that sounded like a threat! I promise it was not!

Making yourself at home, I trust? You must get so tired, running about all over. \n\nThe inn has only the highest quality beds. You will find your rest more than adequate. I will personally guarantee it!
The Three Way War
Neutrality is a dangerous prospect in these times. Seek out and speak to representatives from each of the warring factions to inform your choice of allegiance.

Ah, the old man Yonas, right? Yes, he passes through often, always raving about Corruption. \n\nHe lives outside the walls, in a cabin to the east. Be careful if you're headed that way, or at least don't say I didn't warn you.
"I will be careful."
Hold a moment. You look like someone who's handy with a weapon. \n\nI keep an eye out for such talents. If your allegiance hasn't already been claimed, there are those who'd like to change that.
"Allegiance to whom?"
Well, the towns are always looking for able-bodied workers - got the Town Board for that. \n\nBut if you know how to fight, well, then you could join up with one of the factions.
"What factions?"

The Covenant, Marauders, and Syndicate are the heavy hitters these days, always vying for influence. \n\nYou'll find agents of all three in town, or not far. I'd talk to them. Neutrality doesn't offer many perks, you know?
I really do suggest you seek out the factions when you have time. \n\nFind out what they're all about and join up, if you're so inclined.
Seek out the Covenant
Seek out the Syndicate
Seek out the Marauders
These fish and I, we have a history. My lure doesn't attract their attention much, but I enjoy spending time with them all the same. \n\nIf I really want to catch fish, there are other spots not far.
The Last Soulwarden
Seek answers about the Soulwardens' fate within the tower Arcturus.
Continue your journey, traveler. The fish have grown clever here. \n\nAh, but you are familiar. Two voices, one mind. Yes, we've spoken before. What brings you to my hovel?
"You abandoned me at the ruins."

Oh? Did I abandon you, or did I just walk ahead? I walk a great deal you know, and sometimes, my memories stay behind. \n\nI recall... a path you started to follow, but it was one I've already trodden.
"So you were a Soulwarden?"

Me, a Soulwarden? No… that could not be. It is such a pretentious sounding name. \n\nAnd the Soulwardens are all gone, Lost, Corrupted… who knows? There is a tower, not far. Go get your answers there, for I have none left.
History is filled with the stories of those who resisted the call… stories of failure and doom…
They have breached the tower! Fall back!
Romanos! No!
Retreat! That's an order, Krempel!
They are coming! Yonas, you must go now! Save yourself!
I will not abandon you!
We will follow. Go now! Before it is too late!
I will clear the way. Break ranks! Prepare to retreat!
I am so sorry, Yonas. The Order lives on through you.
Soulwardens! To arms!
We will never surrender!
Hold fast!
Yonas... forgive me...
Never give in!
My mind... is my own...
Stay strong!
Stay... behind me...
We fight to the last!
Never... surrender...
Defeat the echoes of\nYonas' fellow Soulwardens
Defeat the Torment of the Soulwardens
Arcturus. Yes, that's what it's called. Is it a safe place? I believe it was once. \n\nYes, go there, and you will find sanctuary and guidance from those worthy to give it.
Again you return. Again that expectant look on your face. \n\nWhat misery do you bring to me? What answers did the tower provide?
"The Soulwardens are all gone... except for you."
I see. They clamor, their ghosts. Begging me to remember. \n\nI see failure. I see a crushing, final defeat. My friend, I believe your hope is long gone from this world.
Search Arcturus for clues about the Soulwardens' fate
Find the first clue
Climb to the next level
Find the next journal entry
Pass through the Ancient Door
Defeat the spirits of fallen Soulwardens
Find the final journal entry
Speaker of the Angry Earth

Yonas Alazar says that if you want to become a Soulwarden, you'll need a living seed from the Angry Earth. Yonas recalls a woman in the wildnerness, elusive as a shadow, that may be able to help you acquire such a thing, if you can find her.

I truly am the last. All that the Order was, all that it will be, in this decaying mind of mine. \n\nYou've rested your faith in me, but it is unfounded, and there is nowhere else you will find the strength you seek to leverage.
"What if I became a Soulwarden?"

That is a… terrible idea. The process required to harden one's soul against Corruption demands a sacrifice you cannot imagine. \n\nThe days of the Soulwardens are done with, and I have a great deal of fishing to do…
"Please. I need your help."

Bah! Even if you were to pursue such a foolish notion, you would need to forge a weapon capable of combating Corruption. \n\nAnd that would be difficult indeed... the Angry Earth is no longer generous with its seeds of power.
"There must be a way."

There was once a huntress in these parts, an unfriendly and elusive sort. She spoke on the Angry Earth's behalf. \n\nYou might ask about her in Oxboro, but getting her to give you a Living Seed... well, don't say I didn't warn you.
If you've come by any quality furs, do know that I pay handsomely for the right pelts. \n\nOr did you come seeking fashion advice?
"I'm looking for a huntress. Know of anyone?"
The women here are not exactly the rugged sort, if you take my meaning. \n\nThough the ever-so-charming Tekla-- er, Artificer Petrowski-- may know. She IS the sort to traipse around in the woods.
You smell of perfume. Have you been to see Huntsman Lee? What does he want now?
"He said you could help me find a huntress."

He did, did he? I've heard rumors about a strange woman who lives alone in the woods, but it smacks of gossip and folklore to me. \n\nMayhaps there's someone who deals in gossip that could tell you more.
My hunch about this town was right. Did you know the jewelers deal in gold plating? These pampered city-folk truly can't tell the difference. \n\nBut what have you been up to?
"Looking for a woman who lives in the forest."

Well now, that's right strange. I was just hearing tavern talk the other day about some wild woman in the wood. Like a ghost, disappears when you look at her. \n\nI'd ask the captain of the scouts - I'll wager he knows something.
I know a nose sniffing for information when I see one. I have certainly lived here long enough. \n\nWell, get on with it then. What do you want to know about?
"A wild woman, in the forest?"

Hah. There's legends and then there's truth - people talk nonsense, say the huntress is part animal or some kind of spirit. \n\nShe's actually just a recluse, makes a shrine near the mines to the north of her home. I'd look there.
Even if you do manage to track this huntress down, have no expectations. \n\nShe's not fond of other people, as I recall.
You tread on what was once hallowed ground, human. \n\nWhatever your purpose coming here, it is misguided. Go back to your settlement.
"I came to speak to you, actually."
No surprise. Your kind are always speaking, never listening. \n\nThat is why so few of you can hear the whispers of the Angry Earth.
Return to Oxboro
Return to Oxboro and ask\nHuntsman Lee about the huntress
Talk to Artificer Petrowski
Talk to Grace O'Malley
Talk to Franc Dubois
Seek out the huntress to the north
While you flitter off in search of a myth, I will be enjoying the company of my betters. \n\nTheir doting affection will be right profitable, I'm betting.
I have it on good authority that you are becoming a regular around here. \n\nNot causing any trouble, I hope? No, of course not. Not an upstanding citizen such as yourself.
Good luck in your search. Though I do warn you - there have been Corrupted seen in the north.\n\nIf you see any of those red-eyed monsters, I'd suggest steering clear.
I remember that she was beautiful, and terrifying, and ancient, even when I was young…
I burned my hand cooking breakfast this morning… it feels like an omen. \n\nThere isn't anything I should know about, is there? Maybe Franc has heard something…
You should not be in these parts, human. \n\nThis land is wounded, and it will not hesitate to deal with trespassers.
Adiana's Fountain
Explore Kore Rock and purge whatever might be blocking the flow to Adiana's azoth fountain.
You say you've come to see me, but I see only darkness dwelling behind your eyes. \n\nThe actions of your kind have already tainted this place, so what purpose have you now.
"I came to ask a favor."
You are wasting your time and mine. \n\nWhat this land needs is fewer humans, time to heal… and a working azoth fountain. This one seems to be blocked.
"Maybe we can help each other."
The flow of azoth that feeds this fountain comes from the caves nearby, where I suspect it has become blocked. \n\nGet it flowing again and I will at least listen to what you have to say.
The fountain still runs dry. That means you haven’t yet done as we asked. \n\nWas your offer insincere? Or do you lack the strength to follow through?
Well, the fountain is running again, so you've either been blessed with good fortune, or you actually followed through. \n\nI'm curious, however. What caused the blockage?
"Corruption in the mines."
Corruption, blocking the flow of azoth through earthly passages? Impossible. \n\nThere must be another explanation, but I will look into the matter myself.
Investigate {POITags} for\nthe cause of the blocked azoth flow
Destroy sources of Corruption blocking the flow of azoth
Cut down Corrupted Tendrils
Destroy Clotting Carapaces
Burst Incubating Corruption nodules
Weakness of the Ego
Use Adiana's recipe to gather the ingredients to craft a tincture that will dampen the effects of Corruption.
You have done your part, so I will hear what you came here to say. \n\nBut I warn you - I have no sympathy for the plight of humans in the battle against Corruption. It is not our fight.
"I need a seed of the Angry Earth."
Hah. Do you even realize how much you ask? How much your kind has already taken? \n\nThe Angry Earth will want to know the truth: do you plan to use this seed to fight Corruption?
"Yes, I do."
You are honest, aren't you? Good. We loathe deceit. \n\nPerhaps on that account I will make your request. But tell me, do you know why humans fall to Corruption, but the Angry Earth does not?
"Not entirely, no."
Because Corruption's power feeds the ego, your kind's great weakness. \n\nAngry Earth has no ego, and that is how it offers protection. Try this tincture recipe - I believe it will help you.
Have you made the tincture I taught you yet? You're going to need it.
There now, that will afford you some protection, whether or not your request for the Seed is granted. \n\nI communed with the elements while you were away, but they have not yet given an answer.
Acquire Azoth-Infused Mist
Acquire a Verdant Petalcap
Acquire an Engorged Rivercress Stem
Use Adiana's Mortar and Pestle to craft a Corruption Tincture
Adiana tells us you have come here to seek our boon. \n\nWe are not easily given to trust, especially with your kind digging, burning, destroying wherever you go.
Plans of the Pestilent
Adiana Theron suspects the Corrupted of Ebonrock Armory are looking for something. Thin their forces and determine their purpose there.
Your sincerity has impressed me. That is the only reason we are still speaking. \n\nBut I think it will take more than sincerity to earn the trust of the Angry Earth.
"What do I need to do?"
The Ebonrock Caverns nearby are overrun with the Corrupted. \n\nWhile they may pose no direct threat to the Angry Earth, they are a scourge on the land.
"You want me to drive them away?"
You alone could not hope to achieve that. No. Destroy as many as you can, and see if you can discover the source of this most recent incursion. \n\nI suspect they are looking for something.
Red eyes in the dark, watching night and day from the Ebonrock Caverns. \n\nPurge those you can and find out what it is they seek.
Read Note 'Ebony Rocks'
Read Note 'Incursion Notes'
Defeat {targetName}
Your captain's box was just a drop of the source power this island hides… we will find it all.
And even those that believe they are immune shall learn… they too must succumb to her power…
We will not be twisted!
Your arrogance will be your end.
You will join us, or be drained of life.
Banish this foulness! Destroy it!
Your resistance is... amusing.
You cannot defeat... us all...
Release us, human! Please.
We are indebted to you. We will meet again.
My companion has told me all that transpired in the cavern. Not even I knew of the shrine the Angry Earth harbored there. \n\nThat they have succeeded in corrupting it is... troubling beyond measure.
"Didn't you say your kind can't be corrupted?"
I did. I'd prefer to believe this an anomaly, but precautions must be taken. \n\nI must visit the Motherwell and commune with the primal spirits there.
"What about the living seed?"

Your request has been granted, human. You should realize that this required a sacrifice, and it's not a gift that would be given freely again. \n\nStill, you are a fine representative for humanity. I hope this seed protects you well.
Scout Ebonrock Armory for the source of the incursion
Defeat Corrupted Forces
Search for Corrupted Plans:
Investigate the Bonfire
Investigate the Command Tent
Investigate the Feasting Hall
Investigate the Cavern
Defeat Overseer Zane
Rescue Anthurus
Escape the Cavern
We have granted the boon you seek. \n\nOur debt to you is discharged, and we will not hesitate to hunt you should our paths cross again.
A Living Conduit
Adiana Theron has seen fit to grant you a seed of power, a fitting conduit for the weapon of a Soulwarden. Return to Yonas Alazar with news of your success.
Return to your instructor. Convey to him that our gift, and the reprieve that comes with it, is not without condition. \n\nShould your kind abuse it, we will visit our wrath upon you.
"What does the seed do, exactly?"
It grants what your kind lacks - a connection to the earth itself. \n\nGive Yonas my regards. If he is your teacher, then you may yet defeat the darkness in your soul. Begone now, human.
You have what you need, so begone from here. \n\nThis is no longer a place for humans.
It is a relief to see you return, {playerName}. Though my heart trembles to harbor hope again, it's too late to turn back. \n\nYou were able to get a living seed of the Angry Earth, then?
"It took a little convincing."
I'm not surprised. The Angry Earth are not our allies by any stretch of the imagination. \n\nBut you seem to have quite a knack for persuasion.
Return to {POITags}
There is nothing else for you right now. You should begone from here. \n\nBut… I do wish you good fortune in your future travels.

We have but one component of our conduit. Vital though it may be, we must now craft the staff that will contain it. \n\nThrough it, you will draw on the power of your own soul to destroy Corruption where it stands.
The Last Cache
In search of the haft for your Azoth Staff, Yonas indicates the existence a hidden, secret cache within the hidden interior of Canis.
"It's powered by my soul?"
Yes. The relationship between azoth and the soul is complex, but it is this dynamic that gives a Soulwarden their strength. \n\nWhen focused through an azoth staff, it can perform many wonders.
"How do we craft this staff?"

We will start with the haft. The trees from which they were once carved no longer grow on Aeternum. \n\nThe only way is to find one of the hafts we hid away as the days darkened. The Ancient ruins of Canis contain such a cache.
"Who were the Ancients?"

I fear that is a question none remain to answer. The Ancients disappeared thousands of years ago. \n\nWe simply used the ruins to find sanctuary from the Corrupted. In some cases, it worked. Let us hope Canis is one of them.
We knew the tide was turning against us. \n\nI realize now, we created the caches in the hope that a day like this might arrive.
Well now, it's been an age since I laid eyes on one of these. \n\nIt brings back many memories… not all of them painful either.
Search for a hidden cache beneath the obelisk Canis
Find the hidden entrance
Use the teleporter to enter Canis
Leap into the unknown
Descend into depths of Canis
Acquire the haft for your Azoth Staff
Argent and Aether
Search the Ancient ruin of Vulcanus for the materials to craft the Crosspiece of your Azoth Staff.
For the next component of the azoth staff, you must acquire one of our consecrated crosspieces. \n\nIt will be tricky, however, as there are certainly none of these just lying about in an old chest.
"Then where do I get one?"

You can't. We had to melt them all down to make weapons during the last war. \n\nThe forge remains, however, and you may be able to create one yourself. I trust you are handy with a blacksmith's hammer?
"I'll have to make it work somehow."

Yes, you may need to be resourceful. To the west, you will find the Ancient structure that houses the forge. \n\nIt was used by the Soulwarden order even before my time, so you may still find materials scattered throughout.
Mind you tread lightly, young one. \n\nSuch places belong to the past, and the past has a habit of fighting back on this island.
Fan the flames! The forge must not grow cold!
My hammer will make swift work of you!
You will be reduced to ash!
The flame... burns... eternal...
I see you managed it after all. A fine crosspiece, almost as fine as Forgemaster Ezra once made. \n\nDid you have any trouble?
"The Forgemaster was not happy to see me."
Ezra? It stands to reason that he would remain at his forge, even after the light left him. \n\nHe never did let it go cold. I am sure he would be pleased with your work.
Enter the ruins of Vulcanus to craft your Crosspiece
Unearth pieces of silver from the rubble
Gain access to the inner sanctum
Defeat Forgemaster Ezra and claim his hammer
Use the Ancient Forge to craft your Crosspiece
Reignition

With the components of an ancient Soulwarden staff in hand, proceed to the forge beneath Shattered Obelisk. There, you will reignite the flame of the Soulwarden Order by bringing a new Azoth Staff into being.

I fear there is little time left to prepare you for what approaches. \n\nWhile you were away, I met a traveler who spoke of Corrupted coming down from the north. I suspect they are driven on by the same voice that plagues your mind.
"Is she their leader?"

I do not know. The traveler said the Corrupted rally around something called "the Tempest," a being they worship like a god. \n\nIf it is this same being that haunts you, I fear your soul may be in great peril.
"It doesn't change our course."
No, other than to give us a greater sense of urgency. \n\nBut this is a momentous occasion - you are ready to forge your azoth staff, and the Soulwardens will soon be born anew.
"I'm ready when you are."

I cannot go. You must do this alone. It will require the sacrifice of part of your soul. \n\nPlace the pieces of the staff on the Ancient Altar near the Shattered Obelisk, then brace yourself. I will be with you in spirit.
Find the altar near the Shattered Obelisk. \n\nThat is where the staff-forging ritual must take place.
What a marvelous little stick. A shame, for wood and metal can still be broken.
Welcome back, {playerName}. And look at you! Still as fresh as a newborn babe. \n\nMost aspiring Soulwardens return looking at least a little pale. You must have extra soul to spare.
Seek the ritual site beneath the belly of Shattered Obelisk
Create your Azoth Staff
Hope in Your Hands
Deliver news of hope to the people of Everfall. The staff in your hands carries with it the power to destroy Corruption at its roots.
I have had time to give our predicament some thought. \n\nWhile we now possess an azoth staff, it is but a beginning, and even armed with such an implement, we two are no bulwark against Corruption.
"We need to rally others to our cause."

I think so. Go back to Oxboro. Shout from the rooftops. Bang pots and pans if you must. \n\nRally their men and women at arms to meet the armies coming their way. You hold their only hope for salvation.
The strength of men will but stall the Corrupted threat. The staff you hold is the only way to permanently destroy the physical manifestations of Corruption. \n\nShow them the way forward.
I have seen you puttering about town before, and quite busily at that! Seeking rumors and ghosts and all manner of snooping. \n\nJust what have you been up to, hm? A magistrate has a right to know.
"I've come to fight back the Corruption."

Is THAT what all this hustle and bustle was about? My friend, we are perfectly capable of mounting a defense. Our guards are the finest in Aeternum. \n\nWhy not rest a while, perhaps leave some coin at our fine establishments?
Couldn't help but overhear you talking to that Magistrate fellow. \n\nIt's waste of time talking to such jackanapes. Their power is getting others to do things, not doing it themselves.
"Who should I speak with then?"
I've heard the constable here in Oxboro came from the old Roman Empire centuries in the past. \n\nSome say she's gone a little soft in the head, but maybe that means she'll take you serious.
Well that’s a serious face if I've ever seen one. \n\nIs anything amiss? Do I need to summon a guard?
"I came to help you fight the Corrupted."

The Corrupted? You should know it is HORRIBLE bad luck to utter the name of the enemy aloud! \n\nNo, no, no, I'll not have you summon a dark cloud over this peaceful town! I must ask you to leave at once.

Ever since you went in search of your huntress, I've been plying everyone with a modicum of power to do something, anything, to prepare themselves for war. \n\nI confess, I am near to the end of my wits.
Return to Oxboro
Talk to Magistrate Clark
Talk to Grace O'Malley
Talk to Constable Maecia
Seeing is believing. They may not understand what you hold in your hand, but you can teach them with your deeds.
Your pockets sound entirely too heavy. I can recommend some choice venues to leave some of it for our communal coffers. \n\nA settlement this grand does not pay for itself!
I am going to need to ask a priest to consecrate this place after you brought that language in here. \n\nNo, no, don't say anything else. Let's just forget this ever happened.
You're a real puzzle, you know? Delving into ruins and danger to rescue a town that can't be bothered to rescue itself. \n\nSome day I'd like to know just what's knocking about in that head of yours.
Myth Made Weapon

Though the townsfolk of Everfall refuse to help themselves, you have the means to protect them. Guard Captain Franc Dubois enlists your aid to defend the farms against the the growing threat of Corruption.

The fact that you are still standing here suggests there's something you haven't told me. \n\nIf it's about the Corrupted coming, I already know, but these others, they won't understand the danger until it's too late.
"I have a weapon that can defeat Corruption."

Can such a thing exist? It feels too good to be true. Here we are teetering on the edge of disaster, and you conveniently have the answer? \n\nSorry, but I've patrolled the streets of Oxboro long enough to know this ruse.
"It is a relic of the Soulwardens."

The Soulwardens? I've heard stories, but not in any context which would give me hope. \n\nBut by all means, if you want to battle the Corrupted, you'll find them at the farms to the north. I won't be holding my breath.
Perhaps, with proof, I can finally convince this mess of a town to fight back.
And they shall see the faces of those who've accepted the power, and they will know the destiny of the land is already decided.
And they shall see the faces of those who've accepted the power.
And they will know the destiny of the land is already decided.
Raise your fist to this stormy sky, if you must. You are small. Insignificant. But you do not have to remain so. Give in, and join us.
Raise your fist to this stormy sky, if you must. You are small. Insignificant.
But you do not have to remain so. Give in, and join us.
The staff has done its work- I can taste it in the air. Consecrated ground will repel the Corrupted for a time. \n\nI'd say you were born to be a Soulwarden, if that weren't such a tragic notion.
"You can taste Corruption?"

Oh yes, a side effect of the process. Like it or not, you'll be able to taste Corruption soon, too. \n\nLike a rotten tooth, sweet with decay, followed by an aftertaste of blood. It quite ruins dessert, I'm afraid.
Wield your Azoth Staff to destroy the Corruption of The Spread
Defeat Corrupted Invaders
Use your Azoth Staff to destroy Corrupted Growths
Locate the source of the Corruption
Defeat {targetName}
Use your Azoth Staff to clear the Corruption
At the risk of inviting ill luck, I must tell you that your fears were unfounded. \n\nWe've received word the Corruption is actually receding from the northern farms. One less thing to worry about!
You return! I think you will be delighted to learn that our little problem with the Corrupted appears to have taken care of itself. \n\nAll's well that ends well.

I have to hand it to you, you're turning into quite the hero. 

Running off into the woods after a ghost, returning determined to battle those red-eyed demons, and now I hear that SOMEONE beat back the Corrupted in the north. 

Now who could that be, I wonder?
I would not have believed it, if it had not happened so soon after your departure. \n\nWe have new cause for hope in you, my friend, and I am now spreading the word.
I wish they had not delved into this sacred place, but it is serendipitous in a way. \n\nIt is much harder to create a Heartgem than it is to find one.
Destiny Unearthed
Acquire a Heartgem, meant to shield your soul against the effects of Corruption. You can acquire allies to obtain a fallen Soulwarden's heartgem, or seek to create your own.
Forge Your Own Destiny
Search southern Everfall for rare reagents needed to create a new Heartgem.
Don't say I didn't warn you now, but you get used to it, sort of. \n\nThere is just one more thing you need before you can be anointed as a Soulwarden.
"What's that?"

A Heartgem - a vessel you'll use to encase your soul, protect it, a cold vault within your chest. \n\nAnd the place you'll have to go to get one is a cold vault in the earth, beneath the Amrine Temple.
"Why down there?"
It was once a sacred vault, but long-abandoned even during my prime, now an excavation. \n\nIt's the only place I know to get an empty Heartgem. You'll need your staff to gain entry. Good luck.
You should be able to open the Amrine temple door with that staff of yours. \n\nBring back the Heartgem, and we can finally start the ritual.
Look at that - an empty Heartgem. Almost brings a tear to my eye. \n\nTake a good look, because this thing is going to become part of you forever.
To acquire a Heartgem:
Talk to Yonas for Options [Solo]
Complete Quest: Forge Your Own Destiny [Solo]
OR:
Delve into Amrine Excavation [Group]
Enter the Amrine Excavation
Search the Amrine Excavation for a Heartgem
Search {POITags} for the first ingredient
Defeat Ancient Guardians to find an Eternal Guardian's Insignia
Venture into Rames' Refuge for the second element
Use your Azoth Staff to dislodge the Icy Encasement
Seek the third reagent in the outskirts of the Shattered Obelisk
Defeat Ancient Guardians to collect Obelisk Dust
Create your Heartgem in the ruins of Shattered Obelisk
The Ritual
Complete the ritual deep in Amrine Temple to conquer death and become a Soulwarden in full.
A Soulwarden's power comes from creating distance in your soul, like a firebreak in the forest. \n\nThe Heartgem provides that barrier, inuring your soul against Corruption.
"So I'll be immune to Corruption?"

Not entirely. You can still fall to temptation or rage, but it offers protection, a buffer. \n\nSadly, it also buffers against the taste of food, the warmth of sunlight... the love of another. Are you sure you're ready?
"Yes. What do I have to do?"

Oh, that part is simple - easier than it was, at least. You just have to... die. \n\nOnce again, I can't hold your hand, but my spirit is with you, and I will see you on the other side. Godspeed, {playerName}.
Don't worry too much about the ritual. You know you're going to die, so it can't be any worse, can it? \n\nIn all honesty, it probably can, but let's pretend.
You tread on sacred ground. Begone.
Turn back now. Only death awaits you here.
We see your strength. Approach the Forge and embrace your destiny.
Did you think our bond severed?

Welcome back, Soulwarden. You are now part of a legacy that goes back beyond the reach of history. \n\nYou have done more than surrender a life, you have surrendered your own soul. I salute your sacrifice.
Seek out the ritual site within Amrine Temple.
Pass through the Soulwarden Seal
Defeat the Heartforge Guardian
Complete the Ritual
Once upon a time, the initiation of a new Soulwarden was cause to party for three days and nights. \n\nBut there's only two of us now. It would be a very subdued affair.
